Androoster needs root access to work. Otherwise, it's just a waste of storage space ;)

Cannot access Busybox; Androoster needs some special applets to work.\nPlease install Busybox via an app or custom recovery.
This device does not support WebView, which is necessary to view the changelog. WebView is often a system component.
The latest Androoster version (%s) is already installed
An urgent update has been released.
A new testing update is available.
Your installed version contains some issues that may be fixed in the newer version (%s).\nWe recommend installing it quickly.
Androoster %s has been released; update to get the latest features and bug fixes.
Androoster %s is now available, bringing new features and bug fixes.
Androoster %s (Beta) is now available, bringing new features and bug fixes for testers.
Androoster %s is %v release ahead of the market release. Nice!
Androoster %s is %v releases ahead of the market release. Nice!
Cannot check for updates; no internet connection.
Your device is missing Google Play Services :/
We cannot check for updates without it. However, you may receive updates from 3rd party software or app stores like APKPure, Aptoide, etc.
You won\'t be able to receive this update again.
\nWe recommend you update instead of ignoring it.
Kill background processes and clean up memory
Killed some processes and synced filesystem changes with disk
Backing up your configuration onto a file…
Done! You may need to reboot your device to see results
An error occurred while refreshing the backup list. Clear app data and try again.
Tweaks have been successfully applied to the system
Used to be oe of the most used governors on Linux. When your device is getting overloaded, the CPU frequency will be ported at its max. It\'s getting replaced by interactive nowadays.
Little improvements to the basic ondemand governor.
The CPU is always set to its maximum frequency.
The CPU is always set to its minimum frequency.
Slightly raises CPU performance when needed. On old devices, it reduces performance, but extends battery life.
The frequency is decided by applications that are in execution.
Only uses min and max frequencies for handling the cpu (no middle values).
Default and best governor for most devices. CPU frequency switch is ruled by a timer and user interaction.
Custom kernel governor not recognized by Androoster.
Changes are applied, but will only take effect if you reboot right after wiping. Othwrwise, new profiles will be applied per-app.
Xposed can cause some problems; proceed with caution.
Boosts CPU when you need power, and reduces it when you don\'t.
Modifies internal system parameters to make apps smoother and lag-free
Tunes CPU performance to have faster execution, but uses a bit of extra battery
If the governor isn\'t applied, it\'s likely because your kernel doesn\'t support it.\nThe current governor is shown in the table above
Choose the option that you like the most and let us handle the rest :)
Android automatically cleans up memory from unused services, processes, and tasks
Keep memory as fresh and free as possible to make everything more fluid. May reduce battery.
Tweaks to make scrolling and navigation cleaner, smoother, and more responsive
Android memory manager that automatically manages memory; you can change the profile here
Enables native memory packaging (zram) for better overall device performance
Always keep launcher in memory to avoid reloads and have a faster home screen experience
Not enough memory to activate the selected profile
Already wiped; this action really only needs to be performed around once per month
Your device statistics will be cleaned, and your battery will live longer
Your device has not reached 100%. Deleting battery statistics now could harm the operating system. Continue, or wait until fully charged?
Optimizes android default settings to have less battery drain
Android uses this value to scan for new WiFi networks. Higher is better for battery life.
Use less battery when the screen is off
Enables built-in fast charging (works only for devices that support fast charging)
Enables built-in fast wireless charging (works only for devices that support fast charging)
Fix the battery-draining effect some Google apps can produce
Apply a bunch of various tweaks to increase performance
Tweaks the way your phone handles processes
Disables device extended JNI checks to execute tasks faster
If the kernel crashes, the device will auto-reboot after a timeout
Defines how many seconds your device waits in case of crash
Restarts the device if a system operation crashes. This is not recommended, as it can be very inconvenient.
Maximum number of threads the device can allocate for a single task/application
Your device does not support this tweak
Force the device to use Google\' DNS servers for faster connections
Enlarge buffers to speed up downloads and uploads
Extra buffer tweaks for mobile connections
Select the best IPV4 algorithm settings to speed up the network a bit
The hostname is your local network device name
Make calls use the best quality AMR audio codec
Enable fast dormancy on supported carriers
Use wideband to make connections faster
Changes your screen\'s density-per-inch to whatever you set (caution: may break your device)
If buttons are on, more battery will be spent
Using unappropriated numbers may break your device
Enables 16-bit transparency. May modify UI but will make GPU-bound tasks smoother.
Force all apps to support hardware acceleration for better performance
Optimize your disk behavior, trimming blocks not used by the filesystem
Boost every I/O operation on the system partition
Boost every I/O operation on the data partition
Set the max available speed for sd cards (if there are any)
Sets every filesystem partition to ext4 to gain speed on I/O
Filesystems are now mounted as ext4
Filesystems are already mounted as ext4
Checking for fstrim on your system...
Fstrim is not supported on your system
Mounting all filesystems in the device root as ext4...
Clean up and manage your storage with the #1 tool on the Play Store
Clean up unused files in the system
Heavily improves drawing operation performance by adjusting some systemui flags
Forces applications to enable native support for hardware acceleration
Current DPI is %dpi; reboot to apply
Enables system (secured) compiled libraries for faster streaming
Draw 2D layers using GPU (lightens CPU tasks)
Always extract the best-quality JPEG image (gallery, websites, etc.). Uses a bit more RAM
Enable debug mode when USB is connected
Do not show notification when device is connected with USB
Disable built in tracking, saving speed and battery
Adjust parameter to handle internal debug services using less resources
Allow OEM unlock (useful if you want to root, install custom recoveries, etc.)
Disables runtime memory checks to make app execution faster
Disabling can help performance when your device encounters an OOM crash
Disable general system security mechanism to improve performance
Allow installation of apps from sources outside the Play Store
Install applications using ADB without verifying packages
The Global Positioning System (GPS) is a satellite-based radionavigation system that provides geolocation and time information to GPS receivers anywhere on or near the Earth
Allow apps to generate a fake position for this device
Sleep mode disabled (device won\'t go into sleep mode)
Aggressive sleep mode (device will minimize battery usage in standby)
Medium sleep mode (device will only keep core processes running)
For the dialogs library and some other great stuff
For this beautiful page and the theme engine

You can ask questions and find answers about Androoster here
Jump to the app\'s page in Settings
Help us translate Androoster, and get a promotion code to evaluate your version for free
May harm/interfere with the operations of some root applications, but will drastically improve boot time (turn on only if you know what you are doing)
The maximum number of touches that the system can handle
Your phone will ring as soon as it gets the call
We cannot start Androoster because we are missing some permissions. You will have to allow them for Androoster to work as intended.
Restoring workspace and encryption to default state...
No authentication needed to unlock Androoster
Fingerprint will be used as primary login method
No registered fingerprints on this device

You have already bought the pro version
A native, super-reactive, and lightning-fast tweaker for the Android operating system.
Androoster requires root access to work, as it changes system properties that cannot be accessed without it.
Every tweak is instantly applied, but you may have to reboot your device after editing the values to see the effects.
Every tweak is reversible; you can easily manage backups in the Backup section.

Some tweaks may render your device unusable, so please make sure to know what you are doing. I won\'t be responsible for any kind of issue you may meet, as system configurations can vary wildly between devices.
